channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Stormont directed to set up abortion services in Northern Ireland
item.description: Westminster has intervened with a formal direction requiring Stormont to commission services.

item.title: Damien Walsh: Ombudsman finds investigation failures in UDA murder
item.description: An ombudsman's report identifies police failings after the 1993 killing of teenager Damien Walsh.

item.title: Covid-19: Health minister urges caution over easing restrictions
item.description: Ministers are meeting to decide whether some restrictions in Northern Ireland should be relaxed.

item.title: Brexit: No breakthrough on NI protocol after PM speaks to EU chief
item.description: Boris Johnson speaks to EU chief Ursula von der Leyen about the UK's demand to rework the Brexit deal.

item.title: Arlene Arkinson 'let down by criminal justice system'
item.description: An ex-detective who took over the inquiry says police should apologise for searching a family home.

item.title: Nurses' pay: Health Department to bring forward proposals
item.description: It comes after a 3% pay rise is offered to NHS staff in England and Wales.

item.title: Portrush: Mass brawl involving 70 youths at train station
item.description: The train station on Eglinton Street was closed for a period and an 18-year-old arrested by police.

item.title: Belfast GP surgery pays out over sign language interpreter failure
item.description: A mother and daughter did not know they could have had a sign language interpreter during GP visits.

item.title: Newcastle: Boy in critical condition after being struck by van
item.description: An eight-year-old is in hospital after the collision in the Dundrum Road area of Newcastle, County Down.

item.title: Nanotechnology: Seagate-led NI consortium wins £42m grant
item.description: The grant will allow firms to develop new technology for medical devices, communication and storage.

item.title: Drownings: Two deaths in counties Leitrim and Cavan
item.description: Gardaí say there is no foul play suspected in either of the separate incidents on Wednesday.

item.title: NI's trio of female rowers looking for Tokyo glory
item.description: Northern Ireland's trio of female rowers - Rebecca Shorten, Hannah Scott and Rebecca Edwards - tell BBC Sport NI about their journey to Tokyo and their ambitions at the Games

item.title: Is NI's marathon success by accident or design?
item.description: Stephen Scullion, Kevin Seaward and Paul Pollock will form an entirely Northern Irish line-up in Ireland's Olympic men's marathon challenge.

item.title: Fermanagh: Man dies after entering Lough Melvin
item.description: Police received a report that a man had entered Lough Melvin on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Covid-19: More walk-in vaccine clinics open across Northern Ireland
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Two further deaths and 1,973 positive cases in NI
item.description: There are currently 134 patients with Covid-19 in NI hospitals, eight of whom are in intensive care.

item.title: Covid-19: Southern Trust suspends hospital visits as cases spike
item.description: The decision was taken as NI recorded its highest daily number of coronavirus cases since January.

item.title: Interim Covid vaccine certificates to be launched for NI travellers
item.description: Anyone travelling from Northern Ireland after the 25 July should wait to use a new app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hospitality Ulster calls for NI recovery strategy
item.description: Industry representatives say businesses are struggling after lockdown and need help from Stormont.

item.title: Coronavirus: Robin Swann concerned by rise in Covid-19 cases
item.description: More than 1,000 new cases of Covid-19 were recorded in Northern Ireland on Thursday.

item.title: Extreme heat: NI records hottest day ever for second time in week
item.description: The thermometer hit 31.3C in Castlederg on Wednesday, says the Met Office.

item.title: Heatwaves: What do they do to the body and who is at risk?
item.description: What impact do high temperatures have on our bodies?

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Horse-racing bosses condemn abattoir practices
item.description: British and Irish authorities respond to allegations in a Panorama film about slaughtered racehorses.

item.title: 'It's golf with guns' - Kirsty Hegarty's Tokyo journey
item.description: Trap shooter Kirsty Hegarty tells BBC Sport NI all about trap shooting and a surprising addition to her Team GB kit which got her rather excited.

item.title: 'Our lives just finished then'
item.description: A report concludes there were failures in the investigation into the murder of a teenager in 1993.

item.title: Arlene Arkinson's sister calls for public inquiry
item.description: Arlene Arkinson's sister says she had been unable to come to terms with her sister's murder.

item.title: 'A few vases got broke' - meet the boxing siblings
item.description: Brother and sister Michaela and Aidan Walsh tell BBC Sport NI all about growing up together, shadow boxing at home and how they'll treat their mum to new floorboards after Tokyo.

item.title: SDLP leader says UK government has lost trust on Protocol
item.description: Colum Eastwood asks the NI secretary why he thought anyone in Northern Ireland would trust the UK government.

item.title: Londonderry: Department for Infrastructure depot staff go on strike
item.description: Unite the Union says the strike action is over how the department handles staff complaints.

item.title: Arlene Arkinson murdered by child rapist Robert Howard, inquest finds
item.description: An inquest concludes the teenager, who disappeared in August 1994, was killed by rapist Robert Howard.

item.title: Lu Na McKinney: Stephen McKinney guilty of murdering wife
item.description: Stephen McKinney, 44, had denied murdering his wife off Devenish Island, in Lough Erne, in April 2017.

item.title: Western Trust: Families reject care home abuse apology
item.description: The Western Trust issues an apology after a carer is convicted of four counts of ill-treating patients.

item.title: Covid-19: ROI indoor hospitality to resume on 26 July
item.description: Customers will not be subject to time limits and closing time will be set at 23:30.

item.title: Des O'Malley: Founder of Ireland's Progressive Democrats dies
item.description: Originally a member of Fianna Fáil, Mr O'Malley held a number of ministerial posts during his career.

item.title: Bessborough: Second refusal for flats at mother and baby home
item.description: Former residents welcome refusal to allow residential development at the County Cork site.

item.title: Belfast boxer to carry Irish flag at Olympics
item.description: Belfast boxer Brendan Irvine and team-mate Kellie Harrington will carry the Irish flag at the Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony on Friday.

item.title: Croke Park: Eid celebrated by 500 Muslims at GAA HQ
item.description: It is the biggest gathering of Muslims in Ireland since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic.
